page.title: 15PLACES OF WORSHIP
page.content: {St. Mary's (C.of E.) church}is the oldest building in Gainford. It was built in the 13th century by the {Normans.}The church is on the edge of the village green at the S.W. corner. {St. Mary's}is the mother church for a large parish, originally including Piercebridge. The parish church was the only place of worship in the village until 1834 when the{Wesleyan {Chapel}was built. A{Congregational {church}was founded in 1847, followed by a Roman Catholic church in 1854. Today there are three active and flourishing churches in Gainford,{St. {Mary's, St. Osmund's R.C.}and the {Wesleyan chapel.}The{Congregational church is now used as a house. There is a Sunday school at the Chapel. Rev. Lee-Warner, visits the primary school weekly to preach to the children.
